decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful combo using card synergies and abilities instead of relying on lands. By efficiently controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's plans, the deck aims to set up a win condition through a combination of cards like Fallaji Archaeologist, Thundertrap Trainer, and Goblin Charbelcher. With a mix of counter spells, card draw, and utility cards, the deck aims to outpace and outplay the opponent to secure victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on quickly dropping low-cost artifacts onto the battlefield to build a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to generate mana and card advantage, along with efficient creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, the deck aims to consistently put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like Cranial Plating and Metallic Rebuke provide additional ways to increase the deck's offensive capabilities and disrupt the opponent's plans.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to cast big Eldrazi threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also uses control elements like Devourer of Destiny and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck has a good balance of ramp, control, and threats to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful Eldrazi creatures. The key is to control the game early, ramp up mana, and drop big threats to close out the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creature cards like Nethergoyf and Tarmogoyf to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also includes cards like Urza's Saga and Spymaster's Vault to search for additional threats and resources. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while also generating value with cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide. The inclusion of cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Witherbloom Command provide additional utility and flexibility in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing various creature tutors and cheat-out techniques to ramp up quickly and bring out powerful creatures such as Allosaurus Rider, Ghalta, Terastodon, and Griselbrand. By using combos like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, the deck can quickly assemble a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Consign to Memory helps protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly generate massive creatures and close out the game before the opponent can mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to use Allosaurus Rider along with Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to quickly search for and put into play powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. Disciple of Freyalise helps ramp up mana, while cards like Consign to Memory and Planar Genesis control the board. Pact of Negation provides protection for the combo, and cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Xenagos, God of Revels enhance the power of your creatures. The deck aims to quickly assemble a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creature plays and generating additional value from token creatures and small creatures. It also includes some direct damage spells to clear blockers or finish off opponents. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage and Ajani, supported by token generators like Ocelot Pride and Ragavan. The inclusion of high value cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Static Prison ensures flexibility and disruption for the opponent while keeping the pressure on with fast, efficient creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play quickly. The key is to take advantage of cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring creatures back from the graveyard at instant speed for unexpected combos. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With versatile creatures like Atraxa and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using artifacts like Cranial Plating and Urza's Saga to pump them up and deal fast damage. It is built around the synergy between artifacts, with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal providing additional benefits. The deck can generate a lot of mana quickly and is able to both swarm the board with creatures and disrupt the opponent with cards like Metallic Rebuke. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful artifact synergies.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly and aggressively putting pressure on the opponent with a mix of creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence early on with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while also utilizing powerful burn spells like Galvanic Discharge to finish off the opponent. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide added value and card advantage to keep the pressure on. The deck's mana base is optimized to ensure consistent casting of spells and to support its aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Broodscale Bloodchief combo alongside various creatures and artifacts to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker provide threats while Delighted Halfling and Walking Ballista offer utility. The deck also includes powerful spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple helps ramp into bigger threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance through its combination of creatures, artifacts, and spells.

This deck focuses on using Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck also utilizes a combination of spells like Pawpatch Formation, Spell Pierce, and Prismatic Ending to control the board and protect its combo pieces. Leyline Binding helps to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Wrenn and Six provide card advantage and recurring value. Teferi, Time Raveler offers additional disruption and tempo advantage. The mana base includes fetch lands and utility lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a variety of creatures with unique abilities that can be used to create powerful combos. By utilizing cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Chord of Calling, players can search for specific creatures like Sephiroth, Fabled SOLDIER or Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons to generate value and disrupt opponents. The toolbox aspect allows for adaptability in different situations, while cards like Malevolent Rumble and Grist, the Hunger Tide provide additional removal and threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and establish board control through clever interaction of its creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand into play quickly. Cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler help to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan. Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide card advantage and graveyard manipulation. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats, while also disrupting their strategy with counterspells like Force of Negation and removal spells like Prismatic Ending.

This aggressive Death and Taxes deck focuses on deploying powerful creatures quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Solitude and Witch Enchanter. It utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, Ephemerate to protect key creatures, and Fatal Push to remove threats. The deck also includes a variety of creatures with unique abilities to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Managing resource allocation and timing is crucial for achieving victory in the quick-paced matches of Modern 1 vs 1.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Ocelot Pride and Guide of Souls, supported by protection from cards like Giver of Runes. It also includes a mix of aggressive spells like Clarion Conqueror and Malevolent Rumble to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck includes some utility lands like Gavony Township and Castle Ardenvale to provide additional value. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient creature strategy while controlling the board with removal spells and protective creatures.
